articles.title: Biography
articles.contents:
I am a marine ecologist with expertise in long term monitoring of kelp forest environments in California. I graduated from Humboldt State University in 2014 where I studied history, mathematics, and scientific diving. I enjoy outdoor activities such as mountain biking, camping, and freediving. I am currently a master’s candidate of Environmental Data Science at the Bren School of Environmental Science and Management at UC Santa Barbara. I have worked five seasons with Channel Islands National Park’s Kelp Forest Monitoring Program where I developed my skills in subtidal field methods, data collection, data quality control, and database management. I am interested in how ecological communities change in response to environmental stressors such as climate patterns, fishing pressure, and disease events. I aspire to continue working in marine ecology with expanded data processing, modeling, and presentation skills tp apply towards improving our understanding of these complex ecosystems. My goal is to produce products that effectively synthesize long term datasets to understand the processes which drive kelp forest communities, and ultimately share this understanding with the scientific community and the broader public.

articles.title: Resume
articles.contents:
Education
Masters of Environmental Data Science (MEDS) (2022) Bren School of Environmental Science & Management, UCSB - Santa Barbara, California - MEDS Recruitment Fellowship - Advanced Technology Grant - Capstone Project Selection Committee
Bachelor of Arts (B.A.) in History (2014) Humboldt State University - Arcata, California - Minors in Mathematics and Scientific Diving
Certificate in Marine Technology (2018) Santa Barbara City College - Santa Barbara, California - Commercial Diver Certifications
Experience
Teaching Assistant - Department of Economics, UCSB Santa Barbara, CA October to December of 2021 - Grading weekly essays and term papers
Biological Science Technician - Channel Islands National Park Ventura, California Five Seasons (May to October, 2017-2021) - Diver for the Kelp Forest Monitoring Program
Second Captain - Truth Aquatics Santa Barbara, CA July to September of 2019 - Operating 75’ dive vessel
Commercial Diver - Underwater Construction Corporation Stevensville, MI January to April of 2019 - Diver for nuclear power plant maintenance
Deck Hand/Divemaster - Spectre Dive Boat Ventura, CA  March 2017 to July 2019  - Deckhand for a recreational dive boat
Head of Water Department - Pacific Outfitters  Eureka, CA  September 2015 to December 2017 - Managed scuba, fishing, surf, and kayak departments
Director of Scuba - Malibu Divers Malibu, CA June to August of 2014 and 2015 - Managed a youth scuba program at Camp Emerald Bay on Santa Catalina Island.
Volunteer Experience
Data Scientist - Channel Islands National Park Ventura, CA October 2019 to present - Developing an R Shiny web application to teach KFM monitoring protocols, species ID, and data visualization
Scuba Instructor - Humboldt State University Arcata, CA  August 2014 – May 2017 - Dive instructor for the Scientific Diving Program
Volunteer Diver - Reef Check California Mendocino, CA  January 2013 – December 2015 - Participated in citizen science dive surveys
Awards
2021 MEDS Recruitment Fellowship2021 Advanced Technology Grant2019 NPS STAR award for excellence in training KFM Program seasonal staff2015 PADI Elite Instructor award
Publications
Molitor, C.D., McClure, Timothy, I., and others. Channel Islands National Park Kelp Forest Monitoring Program Kelp Forest Community Trend Report for 2005-2019. Natural Resource Report Series. National Park Service, Fort Collins, Colorado. (In preparation)
Molitor, C.D. and others. Channel Islands National Park Kelp Forest Monitoring Program Annual Report 2019. Natural Resource Data Series. National Park Service, Fort Collins, Colorado. (In preparation)
Molitor, C.D. and others. Channel Islands National Park Kelp Forest Monitoring Program Annual Report 2018. Natural Resource Data Series. National Park Service, Fort Collins, Colorado. (In preparation)
Sprague, J.L. and others. Channel Islands National Park Kelp Forest Monitoring Program Annual Report 2017. Natural Resource Report Series. National Park Service, Fort Collins, Colorado. (In preparation)
Sprague, J.L. and others. Channel Islands National Park Kelp Forest Monitoring Program Annual Report 2016. Natural Resource Report Series. National Park Service, Fort Collins, Colorado. (In preparation)
Skills
Computer Languages
Fluent: R, Python, Bash, and MarkdownProficient: SQL, CSS, and PowerShellNovice: MATLABInterested in: JavaScript and Julia
Computer Software & Services
RStudio, Bash, Git, GitHub, Docker, Google Cloud Platform, pgAdmin, MATLAB, JMP, Virtual Box, Microsoft Hyper-V, VMware Workstation, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Office, and more
Boating
2019 USCG 100-ton Captain’s License and Towing Endorsement2012 California Boating Safety Certificate2003 Michigan Boating Safety Certificate
Diving
First certified in 2011 - NPS Dive Examiner - AAUS scientific diver - PADI MSDT - NAUI Instructor - ADCI and ACDE commercial diver - Hyperbaric chamber operator - CCR diver (200’) - ANDI occupational nitrox diver - Ice diver - Cylinder visual inspector
